#Text=Wikinews interviews U.S. Green Party presidential candidate Cynthia McKinney
#Text=Friday , March 7 , 2008
#Text=Wikinews held an exclusive interview with Cynthia McKinney , one of the candidates for the Green Party nomination for the 2008 U.S. presidential election .
#Text=McKinney is a former Democratic Congresswoman from Georgia .
#Text=She was first elected to the House of Representatives in 1992 and held her seat for ten years until being defeated by Denise Majette in 2002 .
#Text=She was the first ever African American woman from her state to be elected to Congress .
#Text=We asked her why she made the recent switch to the Green Party .
#Text=She replied , " Due to the importance of environmental issues , Green issues are the issues of today .

#Text=I would dismantle our military bases in the area , and I would also demand that U.S. and other international corporations relinquish any claims to Iraqi oil or other resources and withdraw as well .

_	_	_	_

#Text=McKinney is running for president because , basically , she thinks that  it 's time that the people win " .

column1: #Text=Interview
#Text=( ( Wikinews ) ) Why are you running for president ?
#Text=Congresswoman McKinney :
#Text=It is clear that the country needs an additional political party that is not beholden to special interests or corporate lobbyists .
#Text=Just 5 % of the electorate , voting for a third party candidate gets the nation just that .

#Text=Therefore , for those who are tired of the ability of special interests and corporate interests to subvert the will of the people , their values , or change their policy makers , winning the 5 % is the best way to infuse structural change into our political system .
#Text=A victory for the Green Party in this election is possible and necessary .
#Text=The alternative we present will appeal to the large numbers of disfranchised voters who do not see the major party candidates addressing their issues .
#Text=In order for a democratic government to work in the public interest , it has to be both transparent and accountable .

#Text=If 5 % vote Green , it will put a third chair at the table of American politics , and it will open the door to the people to see what is going on inside the two-party system that has become controlled by corporations and the expanding power of a military , industrial , and intelligence complex that President Eisenhower warned of in 1960 .
#Text=The Green Party will represent the voices of the majority of diverse and disfranchized voters and citizens and will directly and effectively address their issues .
#Text=I spent my birthday last year protesting in front of the Pentagon .

#Text=At that rally , I stated that upon winning a majority of the seats in the Congress , the Democratic representatives should have repealed the Bush tax cuts , repealed the Patriot Act , the Secret Evidence Act , and the Military Tribunals Act .
#Text=And that the majority in Congress should have voted a livable wage for America 's workers .
#Text=And that someone should be trying to locate the $ 2.3 trillion lost by the Pentagon to pay instead for jobs , health care , and education .

#Text=I was saddened by the Democratic majority 's failure to stop funding the war , and declared my own independence from a national leadership that gave us war crimes , torture , and crimes against humanity .
#Text=Unfortunately , there is not a major party candidate in the race that has not voted to fund this war .
#Text=And that vote to fund what is clearly an immoral and illegal war is a vote of complicity in the torture and war crimes that are being committed as part of this war .
